doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/MS/Harmony Gold Mining Company Ltd FY25 net cash DPS below as expect post trading statement material increase in capex guid_2025-08-28

passages.text: August 28, 2025 07:14 AM GMT
Harmony Gold Mining Company Ltd P Eure  FY25 net cash & DPS below as expect post trading statement; material increase in capex guidance
Strengthens our thesis Impact to our thesis
Modest shortfall Financial results versus consensus
Modest revision lower Direction of next 12- month consensus EPS
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research

Post the 25 August trading statement, the key new news in relation to FY25 is that Harmony are reporting 1/HEPS of R23.37/share at the midpoint of the guidance range; 2/ net cash at 30 June 2025 of R11.1bn (below MSe of R13.5bn) 3/ a final dividend of R1.55/share bringing the FY25 DPS to R3.82/share - while in- line with \(20\%\) payout of FCF per policy this is below both MSe of R4.73/share and Visible Alpha consensus of R4.61/share. At first look through the numbers and in addition to the factors cited in the trading statement we would highlight 1/ adverse impact of a R830m remeasurement of contingent consideration on Eva and Mponeng (of which R338m is cash paid); 2/ Higher exploration expenditure (R915m expensed, R857m capitalised); 3/ A \(31\%\) effective tax rate.

Harmony are guiding production of 1.4 - 1.5m oz (- 5 to \(+1\%\) y/y, MSe 14.8m oz); underground grade of greater than 5.8g/tn (MSe 6.05g/tn); AISC of R1,150,000 - R1,220,000/kg (+9 to \(+16\%\) y/y, MSe R1,221,000/kg); capex of R12.95bn (MSe R10.2bn, prior guidance R10.3bn). Medium term capex guidance has also been increased - now R11.4bn in FY27 (previously R9.4bn), R10.5bn in FY28. This does not include any allocation for the Eva copper project or proposed acquisition of MAC Copper - guidance will be updated at FY26 interim results. The primary driver of the increase in capex is net replacement/ deferred stripping at Hidden Valley where LOM has been extended to 2030 (previously 2028).

Eva copper \(0\%\) increase in indicated copper resource, feasibility study is now in final phase with power solution the key outstanding element. FID will be taken post feasibility completion - project is expected to produce 55- 60k tns of copper pa at a competitive AISC (no change), first production in CY28, no updated capex estimate.
RMB MORGAN STANLEY PROPRIETARY LIMITED+
Christopher Nicholson
Harmony Gold Mining Company Ltd (HAR.J.J, HAR S.J)
EEMEA - Metals & Mining | South Africa
Shr price, close (Aug 27, 2025)
Net debt (06/25e) (mn)\*

Exhibit 1: Key numbers

Production profitRmR/shareFY25FY24ActualMSeGuidanceDeltaActual Change y/yEPS23.1321.80-24.5013.86 67%HEPSR/share23.3721.90-25.0018.52 26%DPSR/share3.824.73-19%2.41 59%CapexRm10.99810.429<10,8005%8.327 32%Cash from ops less capexRm11.64913.071-11%7.252 61%Net (debt)/ cashRm11,14813,474-17%2,899 285%Net debt/ EBITDAxnmnmnm
Source: Company data, RMB Morgan Stanley Research estimates (e)

We use a blended average of DCF and forward multiples. Our DCF valuation is based on the reserve life of mine, using a nominal ZAR WACC of \(14\%\) . We use a forward EV/EBITDA multiple of \(2.6x\) for HAR, derived from the historical average of \(3.7x\) and adjusted down to reflect \(1 / 2\) stage in the cycle and \(2 / \text{HAR's}\) higher cost of production, lower LOM / growth, and jurisdictional risk, offset in part by management execution.
- Rand gold price above MSe- Realisation of value associated with Eva copper / Golpu projects- Value-accretive M&A
- Rand gold price below MSe- Cost inflation ahead of expectations- Project capex overruns / poor project execution- Fatalities/ safety stoppages impacting production- Value-destructive M&A

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI ac Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.

Such information is provided for your reference only.

FirstRand Limited and Rand Merchant Bank (a division of FirstRand Limited) may presently hold a \(1\%\) or more of a class of common equity securities, in any companies covered in this report. This may include holding a net long or short position of US\(1 million or more of Debt securities. Within the last 12 months, FirstRand Limited may have co- managed a public offering, received compensation for investment services, or services other than investment services, or expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment services not disclosed in this report. Additionally, FirstRand Limited does make a market in securities or acts as a corporate broker not disclosed in this report. FirstRand Limited (or its directors, officers or employees) may, to the

extent permitted by law, own or have a position in the securities of any company or related company referred to herein, and may add to or dispose of any such position or may make a market or act as a principle in any transaction in such securities or financial instruments. Directors of FirstRand Limited may also be directors of any of the companies mentioned in this report. FirstRand Limited may from time to time provide or solicit investment banking underwriting or other financial services to, for, or from any company referred to herein. FirstRand Limited (or its directors, officers or employees) may, to the extent permitted by law, act upon or use the information or opinions presented herein, research or analysis on which they are based prior to the material being published.
